subtitle: Ratafias (sometimes called amaretti) are small round almond flavoured biscuits like macaroons - which may be used to replace them.

method.text: Peel and slice apples. Place in a pan with 1 cm water and cook slowly until soft and mushy.
Puree apples. Add soft brown sugar to taste.
Place ratafias in a plastic bag and hit with a rolling pin to make fine crumbs.
Using an electric hand whisk, whisk egg yolks and caster sugar until pale and fluffy. Gradually whisk in Mascarpone and Amaretto liqueur until mixture is smooth.
With clean beaters, whisk egg white in a grease-free bowl until soft peaks form. Fold this into the cream mixture.
Now layer mixture into a glass: a layer of apple, a layer of cream, a layer of ratafias ending with a layer of ratafias.
Chill for several hours before serving.

title: Bramley apple and Amaretto trifles
